intro: Warreopsis colorata, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight hairy texture. Warreopsis colorata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
